Based on your preference cues, I would recommend "The Man from Snowy River" (1982) for its nostalgic portrayal of life in the Australian outback during the mid-19th century.

"The Man from Snowy River" is a family-friendly drama film that tells the story of an Englishman named Johnnie Johnson who travels to Australia's remote Snowy Mountains region to seek his fortune. 

Johnnie Johnson, while searching for gold in the mountains, encounters an elderly man named Tom Brown who has lived in the Snowy Mountains region for many years and knows all about the history and legends of the Snowy Mountains region.

Tom Brown tells Johnnie Johnson a story about how a young Englishman named Alexander Macfarlane traveled to Australia's remote Snowy Mountains region to seek his fortune. 

Macfarlane, while searching for gold in the mountains, encounters an elderly man named George Druitt who has lived in the Snowy Mountains region for many years and knows all about the history and legends of the Snowy Mountains region.

George Druitt tells Macfarlane a story about how a young Englishman named James O'Grady traveled to Australia's remote Snowy Mountains region to seek his fortune. 

Druitt, while searching for gold in the mountains, encounters an elderly man named Johnnie Johnson who has lived in the Snowy Mountains region for many years and knows all about the history and legends of the Snowy Mountains region.
